snippet: Gov. Jay Inslee asked lawmakers to increase spending on K-12 education and raise the state minimum wage as the Legislature began work on the first state budget in six years without a major financial shortfall.
abstract: Washington State Gov Jay Inslee asks lawmakers to increase spending on K-12 education and raise state minimum wage as Legislature begins work on first state budget in six years without major financial shortfall.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jay Inslee asked lawmakers to increase spending on K-12 education and raise the state minimum wage as the Legislature began work on the first state budget in six years without a major financial shortfall.

headline.main: Washington: More Money Sought for Schools and Wages
headline.print_headline: Washington: More Money Sought For Schools and Wages
